alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; West Central Basin and Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 13 at 3:16AM MDT until April 13 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THROUGH 8 PM TODAY FOR MUCH OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO AS WELL AS THE SOUTHWEST MOUNTAINS AND MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR THE EASTERN PLAINS, CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AND MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Winds will increase further on today, once again combining with low humidity, above normal temperatures and an unstable atmosphere to produce critical fire weather conditions over much of southwestern, central and eastern New Mexico. Critical fire weather conditions will likely return on Friday across eastern and portions of central New Mexico as well. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109) and the Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) from noon to 8 pm MDT today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from near 9 to 14 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Highlands; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; West Central Basin and Range
